turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You understand I knew Harry was lying, saying this wasn't any good, but holding on to it, man, like you have to break his fingers to get it from him.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's funny, I was just wondering what I was gonna break of yours to get it away from you.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I'm just explaining to you what I'm doing here. Case you think I come to rob the place, rip off any of this dusty old shit the man has.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'd never make you as a burglar, not in that outfit.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Harry called you his associate, but what does that mean? I never heard your name or read it in Variety or The Reporter or anyplace.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: It's what he said, I'm his associate.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You must bring something heavy to the deal.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's right, me.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Says here you're getting Martin Weir for the part of Lovejoy.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, we're getting Martin.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: No shit, come on. How you gonna do that?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I put a gun right here...  ...and I tell him, 'Sign the paper Marty or your fuckin' dead.' Like that.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I wonder, would that work?  You know who I see for Al Roxy? Harvey Keitel. The man could do it in his sleep.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Harvey Keitel. Yeah. Maybe. He was pretty good in the movie "Fingers".

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I missed that one. Or, hey, you know who else? Morgan Freeman. You know Morgan?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, Morgan Freeman. But he's a colored guy.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: So what? Where's it say in this script he's white? Color is what the part needs, man, somebody to do it has some style. The way it is now, Ronnie could do it, play himself, some cracked out asshole.  So whatta you think of the script?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Title's the first thing's got to go. And the guy's name. I mean, even this writer's name, Murray Saffrin is better than "Lovejoy".

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I'm with you on that. And don't you think it needs a good female part? Increase the romance angle.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: There's Ilona.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Get something going there.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: With Ilona? You know how old Ilona is?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: She's... young.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Young? She's fuckin' nine-years-old, same age as Lovejoy's kid. Bernie. One she calls Bernard. Have you read the script?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, I read it. I was just thinking you could make her older. We might even be able to get Karen Flores.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: She's been out of movies a few years, but she's good. Real good.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You know how to write one of these?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: There's nothin' to know. You have an idea, you write down what you wanna say. Then you get somebody to add in the commas and shit where they belong, if you aren't positive yourself. Maybe fix up the spelling where you have some tricky words... although I've seen scripts where I know words weren't spelled right and there was hardly any commas in it at all. So I don't think it's too important. Anyway, you come to the last page you write in 'Fade out' and that's the end, you're done.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's all there is to it, huh?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: That's all.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I really think I can be of service on this one.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, well, we need a ride somewhere, we'll let you know.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I need the money.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What money?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: The three hundred grand you got from a little dry cleaner named Leo.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Lemme see if I got this right, you break into Karen Flores' house, ask me for three hundred grand, doesn't even belong to you?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I can't believe the way you guys do business out here. I can't believe how fucked up your organization is.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Tell you what...

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: How 'bout I give you to three, then I organize your fuckin' brains all over the wall back there. One...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What, you gonna shoot me now, Bo?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: In just a second. Two...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I don't believe this.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Karen? You okay?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: She can't talk right now.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: That's a nice scream, lady. You oughta be in movies.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Alright, Bo. You can have the money... but it's not here. I have to go get it.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Okay. Fine. The meantime, I'll just hang on to her for safe keeping.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You know Laurel Canyon?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'll find it.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: I'm at 8150 Wonderland Avenue. It's right off Laurel.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Gimme an hour.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Where's Karen?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: In the can. That the money?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: She's great. Gimme the money.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: First you and me gotta get a couple things straight.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You broke in my house and I have a witness to it.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Only this time, no John Wayne and Dean Martin shooting the bad guys in El Dorado.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: It was Rio Bravo. Robert Mitchum was the drunk in El Dorado, Dean Martin in Rio Bravo, practically the same part. John Wayne, he also did the same thing in both. He played John Wayne.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Man, I can't wait for you to be dead.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Bear, you're not really gonna -

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Harry, you think we go to see your movies? I've seen better film on teeth. Makes no difference to me which one our money's in. So how 'bout you take our twenty points out of "Freaks" and put 'em in this other one, "Mr. Loverboy".

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I can't do it.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You positive about that?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's a different kind of deal.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Bo. I'm great. Listen, I'm expecting some people -

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You must be makin' some big deals, doin' lunch in a place like this?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm working on a few things.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Yeah, I hear you bagged Martin Weir for Mr. Lovejoy.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Boy, this town. Word gets around, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Last night. When he called me over to your office to talk about it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Chili Palmer showed you my script?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Yeah, I was wondering why he should do that.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Listen, Harry, how would you like to get your hands on five hundred grand? You pay me back at your convenience, no interest.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You serious?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: All I want in return is to work on the movie with you. Fact I already got some ideas on how to fix it up.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: How 'bout another one for Mr. Zimm. A double.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're gonna just give me five hundred grand?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: We'll talk about that, Harry. But first I gotta know, how'd you hook up with Chili Palmer.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: He was watching Letterman, huh? Sneaky, that Chili Palmer.  So, he ever find this dry cleaner, the one with all that money on him?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Leo, I don't know.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Assuming I go along with this, when can I have the five hundred?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Whenever you want it. The money's in hundred dollar bills inside one of those jock bags, you know? In a locker at the airport, waiting to be picked up.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The airport.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: It was waiting out there on another deal, one that didn't go through; one you don't want to know about.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: It's not the kind of thing you do.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: That's the magic number.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I can hear you, but where the fuck are you, man?

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: What I been wondering is where's he been.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah, where've you been? We haven't heard from you lately.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: Okay. Then be good enough to hand us our money back, or you think about us coming in on this new one.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: By Friday, man, or you're fuckin' dead as disco.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: You get to town, you go straight to the bank, raid the limo account.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I'm already in town, but it don't matter. We got dick in the bank. We dumped it all in Harry's movie.

turns.speaker: BO CATLETT
turns.text: What I'm sayin' is the man wants his money and he wants it now.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ray Barboni?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Are you the guy they called Ray Bones?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Depends. Who's this?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Who is this? I'm the one telling you the way it is, okay, asshole? That's who I am. Now you want your three hundred grand or don't you?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What three hundred grand?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The three hundred grand a guy named Leo Devoe scammed off an airline. The three hundred grand Chili Palmer now has in his possession.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hello? You there?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Yeah, I'm here. I just don't like the anonymous crap. It means your either chickenshit or not for real.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah? Well, trust me. I'm very for real.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Okay. So who are you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I work for Harry Zimm, alright?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Harry Zimm. The man happens to be a major Hollywood player.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Maybe that's because you've never been out've fuckin' Miami, dipshit. Maybe it's time you got on a plane, flew out to L.A. and took a meeting with Mr. Zimm.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: So, what, this Zimm guy asking for some kinda finders fee, that what we're talking about here?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, Zimm doesn't ask for dick. Zimm tells you the way it is... or else.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Or else what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Or else use your fucking imagination.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Where's Leo Devoe? Where's Chili Palmer? Where's my fuckin' money?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ray. Look at me.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look at me, Ray.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You say look at you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's correct. Look at me.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: How'd you get in here?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I told them I was you. I acted stupid and they believed me.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: So what brings you to L.A., Bones?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Don't insult me. Get up and turn around.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Why would I do that?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: 'Cause the guy's a customer now, stupid. His ass belongs to me.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I checked the bag at the airport, when I came.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Yeah? Which terminal?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Sovereign.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You found Leo, didn't you? Took the poor asshole's money and put it in a locker, ready to go.  Why haven't you left?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I like it here.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Look, there's no reason you and I shouldn't get along. Forget all the bullshit from before - I don't even remember how it started. You took a swing at me over some fuckin' thing, whatever it was - forget it. You owe me some money, right? Forget that too. But, you don't say a fuckin' word about this to anybody. It's strictly between you and me, right?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Whatever you want, Ray.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Who the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Ray Barboni. From Miami.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: What, like that's supposed to mean something to me?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: The man you're steppin' on belongs to me and my partner.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: He owes me money.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Get in line, bro.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I don't like waiting.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Tough shit, bro. This ain't Miami. You want something, talk to me.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Hey, fuckball, I don't need your permission. L.A.'s an open city.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You a quick draw... 'bro?' You better be, your piece stuck way down in your belt like that.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Whatta you got there... some kinda pop nine, the fuckin' Fiat of guns, always jammin' at the wrong time.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: You live in Miami?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: What're you doing in Los Angeles?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm in the movie business.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: You're an investor, is that it?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm a producer.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: You have a card in here?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Not yet. I just started.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Your wife a Lakers fan?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I am. I'm a fan of everything that's L.A. I love it out here.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: By the way, you recall the number of the locker you used?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: It was C... I don't know, sixteen or seventeen, one of those. Why? You looking for anyway, a bomb or something?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Something shouldn't be there.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Why don't you get the attendant to open all the lockers and take a look. Maybe you'll find it.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: That's the idea. I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's what I'd do.  Make sure I got the right guy next time.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Get him out've here.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Anyway, you want this guy, he's in L.A. We put him on a flight after he spanked one a my cocktail girls in the Keno room.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Leo spanked a waitress?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Apparently, way it went, he invited her to come to Santa Anita to play the ponies with him. She told him what to do with that and he gave her one on the tush. My guess, he's by his lonesome at the track right now.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hey, Chil? Since you're goin' out to L.A. anyway.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What've you got?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Guy owes us a hundred and fifty grand, sixty days over; a movie producer.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Movie producer? Yeah, why not.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jesus, if I have a heart attack, I hope you know what to do.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Where you been, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Have we met? I don't recall.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: We just did. I told you my name's Chili Palmer.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Did you stop to think what if I had a heart attack?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You look okay to me, Harry. Come over here and sit down. Tell me what you been up to.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm looking at you.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I want you to keep looking right here, okay?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You know Dick Allen, Mesa's Casino?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Dick Allen's a very dear friend of mine. How far you want to go with this?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: We're there, Harry. You signed markers for a hundred and a half, you're over sixty days past due and you haven't told anybody what the problem is.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Operator, how do I get Las Vegas Information?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Harry, lemme give you some advice.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: A marker's like a check, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I know what a marker is.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: They don't want to deposit yours and have it bounce. That annoys them. So your dear friend Dick Allen's been calling, leaving messages on your machine, but you never get back to him. I happen to be in Vegas on another matter, and Dick asks me as a favor would I look you up. I follow you over here, see you in the window with this woman, looks a lot like that actress Karen Flores, was in Grotesque, except she's not blond anymore...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You're not looking at me, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why do I have to keep looking at you?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I want you to.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You gonna get rough now, threaten me? I make good by tomorrow or get my legs broken?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Come on, Harry - Mesas? The worst they might do is get a judgment against you, uttering a bad check. I can't imagine you want that to happen, man in your position.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Fuckin' basketball game.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You make movies, huh?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I produce feature motion pictures, no TV. You mentioned Grotesque, that happened to be Grotesque Part II that Karen Flores was in. She starred in all three of my Slime Creatures releases you might have seen.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Karen, say hello to Chili Palmer. Chili, this is Karen Flores.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Karen, it's a pleasure. How you doing?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You want to hear this idea? It's about a dry cleaner who scams an airline out of three hundred grand. Go on, tell her.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You just did.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I mean, the way you told it to me. Start at the beginning, we see how the story line develops.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's the kind of situation, you don't pay, you get your legs broken.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Or the guy thinks he could get 'em broken. You have to understand the loan shark's in business the same as anybody else. He isn't in it to hurt people. He's in it to make money.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Without him. The guy's so out of it he doesn't even know it's gone.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's right. As a matter of fact...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Keep going.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Well, since Leo's name was on the passenger list...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So he comes to L.A...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I don't know about his wanting to meet celebrities, that's something new. But, yeah, he comes to L.A. Then after that, I don't know what happens.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's it? That's your movie?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I said I had an idea, that's all.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's half a movie, with holes in it. Maybe forty minutes of screen time. You don't even have a girl, a female lead, and on top of that, there's no one to sympathize with, you don't have a good guy.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: The shylock's the good guy.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The shylock? He's barely mentioned. And it's not believable the wife would get a settlement that fast.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Part of it, yeah.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wait a minute, you're not the guy, are you? The dry cleaner?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You mean, Leo?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You wouldn't be talking to me if you were.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm not the guy, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: But you work for the casino?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm out here looking for Leo. I just looked you up as a favor to your dear friend, Dick Allen.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So you don't work for the casino?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Is that right, that's what you do for a living?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What I did till recently.  After I get done here I'll think about what I'm gonna do next.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I imagine in your line of work, there were times you had to get rough, you know, say one of your customers stopped paying.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: They always paid.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You pack a gun?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Maybe a few times I have.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ever shot anybody.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Once.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Really? You ever been arrested?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I've been picked up a couple times. Loan sharking. Racketeering. But I was never convicted. I'm clean.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Racketeering, that covers a lot of ground, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: These guys, my investors, they run a limo service, came to me originally, put money in a few of my pictures and did okay, they're happy. So they come in on another deal - this was back a few months ago when I was planning what would be my next picture, about this band of killer circus freaks that travel around the country leaving bodies in their wake. The characters, there's this seven- hundred-pound fat lady who has a way of seducing guys, gets them in her trailer -

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Harry, look at me.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You're trying to tell me how you fucked up without sounding stupid, and that's hard to do. Let's just get to where you're at, okay? You blew the two hundred grand the limo guys gave you in Vegas on a basketball game and you haven't told 'em about it. Why not?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Because they're not the type of guys would take it with any degree of understanding or restraint. The first thing they'd do is break my legs.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You got that on the brain, Harry. If you're so scared of 'em why'd you take their money to Vegas to begin with?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Because I need half a million to buy a script.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: For a movie?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A blockbuster. But quality. No mutants or maniacs. This one's gonna be my "Driving Miss Daisy".

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What's it called?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: "Mr. Lovejoy".

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: "Mr. Lovejoy"? That's the title?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not bad when you know what it's about.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Murray Saffrin, guy who wrote it, did all my Grotesque pictures, had it in a drawer for twenty years. He shows it to me one day, tells me he's got a star interested, would I produce it.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Who's the star?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Two time academy award nominee, Martin Weir.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Martin Weir. He played the mob guy that turned snitch in "The Cyclone".

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: One of his best parts.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: No, his best part was the cripple gay guy that climbed Mt. Whitney.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: "Ride the Clouds". Good picture.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: She looks familiar.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's a rock star. Every day, same time, they come down here and have breakfast. He has the egg white omelet; she has the banana pancakes. He sits facing west so he can see his billboard. She faces east so she has an excuse to wear the shades.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Anyway, Murray has this shrink, who also happens to be Martin's personal trainer's shrink. Murray gives the shrink the script and the shrink gives it to Martin's trainer who reads it to Martin while they work out, and Martin flips. Loves it.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The problem is Murray. He and a few other blocked screenwriters went river rafting down the Kern a few weeks ago. Murray never made it back.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: He drown?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Heart attack. Apparently they brought a couple hookers along.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Doris, Murray's widow, finds out about this Martin Weir thing and says since Murray and I never had any written contract, she wants five hundred grand for the script.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: So you're thinking what if I was to put you next to my dry cleaner. Ask him if he wants to invest his money in a movie.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That, or I'm thinking what if some tragic accident were to befall the widow Saffrin -

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm not gonna pop her, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just a thought.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: But I could talk to the limo guys. Tell 'em to leave you alone for a while. Make the point in a way they'd understand it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't even know these guys.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Harry, I probably know 'em better than you do.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What do you get out of this?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Let's see how we get along.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Lovejoy sits behind the wheel, watching the bar across the street, getting his video camera ready for action...  What's he doing? Following a guy?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Read it. It's a grabber.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: No leave 'em up, we want the light in their eyes. I'll be at the desk... but don't introduce me, let it go, just start talking. You're gonna be here, behind 'em when they sit down.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They'll be looking at you. They don't know who you are.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's right, they're wondering, who's this guy? You don't tell 'em. Understand, Harry? Do not tell 'em who I am.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You don't say any more'n you have to. You say, 'Well, I'm glad you assholes stopped by, so I can set you straight.'

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're kidding, right?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I don't know, maybe I wasn't clear. But I thought... I told you to keep your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I had to tell 'em something.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Never say anything unless you have to.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You tell me you want these guys off your back. Next thing I know, you're saying yeah, maybe they can have a piece of Mr. Lovejoy. I couldn't believe my fuckin' ears.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I said I'd think about it. What does that mean? In this town, nothing.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's the difference between you and me, Harry. I say what I mean. I want something from someone, I ask 'em straight out. I want Martin Weir, I go get Martin Weir. I don't fuck around with his trainer's shrink.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: His shrink's trainer.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How's anyone gonna see anything from way up there?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Hey, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, Chili. Hi.  You're fifty feet in the air!

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Here's your keys, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Get the fuck outta my chair.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Is he giving you a check or cash?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Cash. It happens to be waiting right at this moment in a locker at the airport.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Okay, Harry, I'm wrong. You're not the one he's setting up.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I mean, at least Bo's invested in three of my movies.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, he wants us to talk to Buddy, set up a meeting.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A meeting with who? You and Karen?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So how 'bout it, Mr. Selznick, do I make my deal with Bo? Or you gonna finally help me out, have a word with your dry cleaner when you find him.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I found him.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Forget about Leo's money, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You have it?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Harry, if I gave you Leo's money you'd have Ray Bones all over your ass and then you'd be in a whole new kinda trouble.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Ray Barboni. Guy from Miami, owns Leo now that Momo died.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Who the fuck is Momo? Jesus, these fucking names...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Tell you what, Harry, tomorrow morning, when the airport's crowded, I'll go check it out. If I don't see a problem, I'll pick up the money...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Maybe I oughta talk to this Ray Bones character myself. See if he wants to invest in my movie.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Don't waste your time, Harry. The guy's not much of a movie fan. Now c'mon, gimme the key.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: You cut straight hair in this place, or just fags?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Hey, Bones, looks like you're gonna have a nice scar up there. Maybe these guys can fit you with a rug, cover it up for ya.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: You got a miss. Leo Devoe. Guy's six weeks over.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: He died.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: How'd you know he died, he tell you?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, he told me.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: Personally?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, Ray, he personally told me he got killed in that Get Away Airlines' jet went down last month.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: What Get Away jet?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: It was in the Herald.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: Yeah, well, maybe the guy took out flight insurance. Check with the wife.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Hey, it's your book now. You want to check it out, go ahead. He's got a dry cleaning business out on Federal Highway.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: Which also means when I speak, I'm speakin' for Jimmy. So e.g. as of now, you start affording me the proper respect.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: 'E.g.' means 'for example', Ray. I think what you wanna say is 'i.e.'

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: Bullshit. E.g. is short for 'ergo'.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Ask your man here.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: You owe me the dry cleaner's fifteen grand plus the juice which is what another, uhh...

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Twenty seven hundred.

turns.speaker: RAY BONES
turns.text: Exactly. You either get it from the wife or out of your own pocket, I don't give a fuck. You don't ever hand me a book with a miss in it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yeah. That was a good party.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You know, Marty, you were good in The Cyclone.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Martin. It was a beautiful role. All I had to do was find the character's center, the stem I'd used to wind him up and he'd play, man, he'd play.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Well, you had it down cold. Watching you in the movie, if I didn't know better I'd have to believe you were a made guy and not acting. Even the fink part. I never met a fink and I hope to God I never do, but how you did it must be the way finks act.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: A few weeks before shooting, I went back to Bensonhurst, just to listen to you guys. See, I'm Italian, but I grew up in Tarzana. So I wanted to pick up your rhythms of speech.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: We talk different?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: It's more like your attitude. Your tone, your speech patterns demonstrate a certain confidence in yourselves, in your opinions, your indifference to conventional views.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: You mean like we don't give a shit.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yeah. Kinda. Anyway, once I have the authentic sounds of speech, the rhythms, man, the patois, I can actually begin to think the way those guys do, get inside their heads.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: So you don't know what I'm thinking.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No, I don't. Though I have to say I'm curious.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: So you want to know.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: If you'd like to tell me, yeah.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I'm thinking of a movie.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: One of mine?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: One we're producing.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: With what? Wiseguy money?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Martin, I'm not connected to those people anymore. Not since I walked out of a loanshark Operation in Miami.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What happened? The pressure got to you?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Pressure? I'm the one applied the pressure.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Guy owes me fifteen large and takes off, I go after him. The fuck you think I do?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Martin, look at me.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I'm looking at you.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: No, I want you to look at me the way I'm looking at you. Put it in your eyes, 'You're mine, asshole,' without saying it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Like this?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: What you're telling me, you're tired? You wanna go to bed?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Wait. How about this?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Now you're squinting like you need glasses.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: How about this?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: That's not bad.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: That's what I think of you, asshole. Nothing.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: I believe it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I turn it on when I confront the guy.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Yeah, but you haven't found him yet.  The guy took off for Las Vegas.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: How do I know that?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: The wife sues the airline.  This is a gutsy babe.

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: Good-looking, too.  Like Karen.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: So when do I meet up with the husband and give him the look?

turns.speaker: CHILI
turns.text: It's not that simple. You have to be careful. There's another guy that comes along, a hard-on you owe some money to. A mob guy. Wants to take you out anyway, on account of a past situation.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Okay. I'm listening.
